business.UI

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • business.UI.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CmdAddAlbum, CmdAddAudioBook, CmdAddPlaylist, CmdAddSong, CmdAppendToAlbum, CmdDeletePlaylist, CmdHelp, CmdListAlbums, CmdListAudioBooks, CmdListOrderedSongs, CmdListPlaylists, CmdListSongs, CmdQuit, CmdSave

    public abstract class Command
extends java.lang.Object
    A command, part of a chain of responsability, looks at the arguments provided by the user, and then evalute if the command is able or not to fulfill the request. if the command can handle it, then the command will do so, and otherwise, if it does not, the command will ask the next command of the chain to perform this whole process again.

      • attempt

        public java.lang.String attempt(java.lang.String argsAll,
                                DirectAccess access)
                         throws ForceQuitException
        Test if the current command is the one supposed to process the request then process it, or pass the request to the folowing command handler
        Parameters:
        argsAll - the full input submited by the user
        access -
        Returns:
        the output String returned by the executed command
        Throws:
        ForceQuitException

      • doStuff

        protected abstract java.lang.String doStuff(java.lang.String args,
                                            DirectAccess access)
                                     throws ForceQuitException
        Actually perform the task the command is meant to do
        Parameters:
        args - striped of the first arg (which only define the action to perform)
        access - provide an access of the commands on the data
        Returns:
        a string containing the command output
        Throws:
        ForceQuitException
